content.description:
Move up broken cracks to a short dihedral that take great gear. The only real 5.4 move is in the dihedral right before pulling over the lip.

This climb is not setup well, it typically is used to gain the upper tier. To descend head towards one of the anchors on climber right.
content.protection: 0.4, 0.5, 0.75, couple slings. Bolted anchor to right.
content.location: Look for the short corner dihedral on the far left of the area.

content.description:
Climb up broken blocks to a right handed shield. Take the stellar right handed crack to the seem. The seem is formed from two conjoined finger cracks. Progress up and over the mini  roof into some short finger cracks.

Once on the tier... climb a couple 5.5 moves up to the right to bolted anchor.
content.location: The leftmost distinctive dihedral in the area

climbs.name: Desert Flower Bowling Alley and Arcade Fun Complex

content.description: Climb up broken blocks to a dihedral hand crack.  Get into a hand crack that widens to large fist and then it gets slightly overhung hand crack. Followed by a short section to bolted anchor.
content.protection: 2-3 in fingers, 2-3 in fist pieces to bolted anchor
content.location: This is on the left side of the broken flake.

content.description:
Climb up the face using a couple pockets and a thin finger crack with a few pods. Then use an awesome undercling and grope left for a jug. Then finish up the left arete.

Optional: Some may want a piece for the section to the first bolt, but the climbing is pretty comfortable.
content.location: Between the two obvious spires with the bolts

content.description:
Climb up the wide right side of the flake. Pull some internal holds. At the crux it is a little overhanging and larger than a #6 however there is a great left foot and leg lock.

You don’t need to go full offwidth if you use some finger pockets to pull up into the leg lock. Then pull over a great move to a great stance.

Style: Hands and fists
